article.headline: Belmont 92, Campbell 60
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Adam Mark and Steve Drabyn each scored 22 points to lead Belmont to a 92-60 victory over Campbell on Saturday. The Bruins (11-5, 6-3 Atlantic Sun) also got 15 points from Josh Goodwin and 14 from Jese Snyder to win their seventh straight at home. The Camels (1-16, 1-9) were led by Dominique Klein with 14 points and 10 rebounds. Lee Marsh added 12 points for Campbell, which turned the ball over 21 times and lost its 26th straight road game. Belmont's Snyder hit three 3-pointers during a 20-5 run in the first half that broke the game open. The 92 points and margin of victory match conference-game highs for Belmont since it joined the Atlantic Sun three seasons ago.
